visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a column chart with the following specifications: Chart type: column, Chart title: 'Fruit Consumption', Axes and labels styling: Use a dark blue color (#003366) for the title and axis labels, with a font size of 14px for the title and 12px for the axis labels. Data series: One series named 'Fruits' with data [1, 4, 3, 5] corresponding to categories ['Apples', 'Pears', 'Bananas', 'Oranges']. Custom colors: Use a gradient from light green (#90EE90) to dark green (#006400) for the columns. Additional configurations: Set the chart background to a light gray (#F5F5F5), add a legend with the title 'Legend', and position it at the top right of the chart. Also, set the chart margins to 50 pixels on all sides.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object is configured to render a column chart titled 'Fruit Consumption'. The chart type is set to 'column', and the data series includes one series named 'Fruits' with data points [1, 4, 3, 5] corresponding to the categories ['Apples', 'Pears', 'Bananas', 'Oranges']. The title and axis labels are styled with a dark blue color (#003366) and specific font sizes. The columns are colored with a gradient from light green (#90EE90) to dark green (#006400). The chart background is set to a light gray (#F5F5F5), and a legend titled 'Legend' is positioned at the top right. The chart margins are set to 50 pixels on all sides to ensure adequate spacing around the chart.
